history.content:
tl;dr: to see the topics covered in 160, check out the website here!

CS160 is a project-heavy course organized around one giant group project near the second half of the semester. It teaches you the design process and how to approach design projects through user research, wireframing, prototyping, testing, and iterating. Regardless of what you might have heard, 160 isn't a class that teaches you how to "make things look pretty"! You focus more on the iterative design process and how to design you final project to best suit a user need / target audience. However, design can a lot more subjective than your typical CS class, so keep that in mind.

Previous classes have focused on more novel design interactions (like smartwatches w/ Android Wear, and most recently IOT devices on the Kinoma platform). You can check out what previous students have created in their final project here (Fall 2015) and here (Spring 2016)

children.subject: I took it spring 16. So basically the reason you haven't heard great things about it, in my opinion stems from the disconnect between the assignments and what you learn in class. In lecture you're taught things like typography and color theory, and in discussion they talk a little bit about android. But then they give you these crazy android assignments (hw 2 used like 4 or 5 different APIs and interacted between the phone and watch). People spend so much time getting SOMETHING to work, so there's like no time to focus on anything design related when it came to the homeworks because the points were mostly in the functionality of the hw. To be fair, the TAs really made an effort to improve the experience of the class from fall 15 and spring 16 and it really helped. The watch code would have been so hard without their help. I guess the best way to describe the class (in my opinion) is like a semester-long hackathon where you learn android. It's a hackathon because you basically teach yourself android and then make something (an app that's a group project). If you get a good group, then it's really cool. I had an amazing group and loved what we made. So yeah that's my review of 160 from sp 16

history.content:
Hi,


I wanna take 160 next semester, but I haven't really heard stellar reviews about it.. If you took 160, how much work was the course, and what was it like? What kind of material was discussed in lecture?
